PUBLIC "`PUBLIC "-//David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NDD::::J. Walter Thompson Company. New York Office. Media Center Audio-Visual Collection)//EN" "jwtnymediacenter.xml" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (sy2003-10-15).

Also, the top level of the finding aid (above the dsc) changed to conform to current Rubenstein Library and NC EAD standards as laid out in the Inventory Style Guide and in the NCEAD Best Practice Guidelines. Within the dsc, dates for series were normalized. These changes were made by Michelle Belden.
Also, container TYPE and LABEL attribute values were standardized according to the Rubenstein Library EAD 2002 manual and the NCEAD eadlocal.ent by Ruth E. Bryan.
The tag list inside index was changed to indexentry by Ruth E. Bryan.

Additions (2003-0231 and 2003-0232) made to electronic finding aid. Materials received as a transfer, 2003. Minimally processed by Stacey Clarke on December 1, 2003. Encoded by Stacey Clarke and Elizabeth Arnold on December 1, 2003. Date span changed from [1980s]-2001 to [1980s]-[2000s]. Linear feet changed from 6.8 to 27.3. Item count changed from 281 to 536.

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. New York Office. Media Center Audio-Visual Collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. New York Office. Media Center Audio-Visual Collection was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2001-2002.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Ruth Bryan, Danielle McGregor, Elizabeth Arnold
Completed November 7, 2003
Additions minimally processed by Stacey Clarke
Last Updated December 8, 2003
Encoded by Elizabeth Arnold
This collection is unprocessed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company was founded in New York, N.Y., in 1864, and is one of the world's largest advertising agencies.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection is comprised primarily of 121 audio cassette tapes of radio commercials produced for various clients by JWT San Francisco ([1980s-early 1990s]) and collected by the Media Center. Formerly called the Creative Library, the Center makes available to JWT staff the creative products of various JWT offices. Also includes 6 CD-ROMs of print ads from JWT offices in Asia Pacific Region (1998-1999); 22 color slides of print ads from JWT Argentina (1997-1998); and 1 DAT of 8 radio spots for Lipton Ice Tea and monthly calendars, both produced by the New York Office (2000-2001). Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising and Marketing History.

The addition (2002-0203; 117 items, 5.0 linear feet) consists largely of tapes of radio commercials for a variety of JWT clients and brands, especially Eastman Kodak, Lipton, Trident, and Weight Watchers. Formats include VHS, U-Matic, and D-2 videotapes; DAT and digital audio mastering tapes; computer disks; and 8mm data storage cartridges. Also includes VHS copies of various films and TV shows.

The addition (2003-0231; 80 items, 5.5 linear feet) consists largely of video tapes of various commercials from JWT international offices, including ads for Listering, Nestle, Siemans, and Kellogg products, and possibly the only existing cpy of a Kodak "Wedding" ad. Also contains one audio CD and a small number of print ads.

The addition (2003-0232; 175 items, 15 linear feet) consists largely of video tapes of various commercials from JWT international offices, especially London, Asia and Latin America. Also includes Video Strategies USA tapes of ads that premiered 1981-1983, Worldwide Creative Council, and other spots.
